item.title: Devowasright add a quote by Warren Ellis
item.description: "Did you ever want to set someone's head on fire, just to see what it looked like? Did you ever stand in the street and think to yourself, I could make that nun go blind just by giving her a kiss? Did you ever lay out plans for stitching babies and stray cats into a Perfect New Human? Did you ever stand naked surrounded by people who want your gleaming sperm, squirting frankincense, soma and testosterone from every pore? If so, then you're the bastard who stole my drugs Friday night. And I'll find you. Oh, yes." -- Warren Ellis

item.title: Devowasright add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Devowasright add a quote by E.B. White
item.description: "If the world were merely seductive, that would be easy. If it were merely challenging, that would be no problem. But I arise in the morning torn between a desire to improve the world and a desire to enjoy the world. This makes it hard to plan the day." -- E.B. White

item.title: Devowasright add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "Facts do not cease to exist because they are ignored." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Devowasright add a quote by David Byrne
item.description: "Sometimes it's a form of love just to talk to somebody that you have nothing in common with and still be fascinated by their presence." -- David Byrne

item.title: Devowasright add a quote by Hermann Hesse
item.description: "When I have neither pleasure nor pain and have been breathing for a while the lukewarm insipid air of these so called good and tolerable days, I feel so bad in my childish soul that I smash my moldering lyre of thanksgiving in the face of the slumbering god of contentment and would rather feel the very devil burn in me than this warmth of a well-heated room. A wild longing for strong emotions and sensations seethes in me, a rage against this toneless, flat, normal and sterile life. I have a mad impulse to smash something, a warehouse, perhaps, or a cathedral, or myself, to commit outrages, to pull off the wigs of a few revered idols..." -- Hermann Hesse

item.title: Devowasright add a quote by Edgar Rice Burroughs
item.description: "We are, all of us, creatures of habit, and when the seeeming necessity for schooling ourselves in new ways ceases to exist, we fall naturally and easily into the manner and customs which long usage has implanted ineradicably within us." -- Edgar Rice Burroughs

item.title: Devowasright add a quote by Octavia E. Butler
item.description:
"All that you touch You Change.
All that you Change Changes you.
The only lasting truth is Change.
God is Change." -- Octavia E. Butler

item.title: Devowasright add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "I guess that's the story of life: what you most fear never happens, but what you most yearn for never happens either. This is the difference between life and fiction. I suppose it's a good trade-off. But I'm not sure." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Devowasright add a quote by Warren Ellis
Devowasright add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "When two people meet and fall in love, there's a sudden rush of magic. Magic is just naturally present then. We tend to feed on that gratuitous magic without striving to make any more. One day we wake up and find that the magic is gone. We hustle to get it back, but by then it's usually too late, we've used it up. What we have to do is work like hell at making additional magic right from the start. It's hard work, but if we can remember to do it, we greatly improve our chances of making love stay." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Devowasright add a quote by Theodore Sturgeon
item.description: "90% of everything is crap." -- Theodore Sturgeon

item.title: Devowasright add a quote by John Brunner
item.description: "There are two kinds of fools. One says, "This is old, and therefore good." And one says, " This is new, and therefore better." -- John Brunner
